intro: Oreomyrrhis andicola, commonly known as the Andean orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers. This species typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its morphology includes narrow leaves and a compact growth habit, adapted to its harsh environment. The plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity in its native range.
